response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 21, the individual is in a high-risk age group for recidivism due to the general association of young adulthood with higher rates of rearrest."],
    ["Race", "low", "Being White does not, in itself, increase the likelihood of recidivism when compared to other racial groups in risk assessment studies."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "Having one arrest and conviction indicates prior involvement with the criminal justice system, representing a moderate risk for reoffending."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lacking a high school diploma or GED is strongly associated with higher recidivism, as lower educational attainment correlates with fewer economic opportunities."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding only 2 jobs in the year suggests some level of instability in employment, which can contribute moderately to the risk of rearrest."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use over the past four years introduces a moderate risk factor, particularly in the context of criminal behavior patterns."],
    ["Living Arrangement", "low", "Not living alone can indicate some level of social support, thereby reducing recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "medium", "Never having been married can be associated with less social stability, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in a small household (size 2) with only the biological dad may imply limited familial support, contributing a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Geographic Area", "low", "Growing up in a rural area is generally associated with lower rates of recidivism relative to urban environments."],
    ["Religiosity", "low", "Believing that God influences personal outcomes can be a protective factor that is associated with lower recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 21, the individual is in a high-risk age group for recidivism due to the general association of young adulthood with higher rates of rearrest.
Being White does not, in itself, increase the likelihood of recidivism when compared to other racial groups in risk assessment studies.
Having one arrest and conviction indicates prior involvement with the criminal justice system, representing a moderate risk for reoffending.
Lacking a high school diploma or GED is strongly associated with higher recidivism, as lower educational attainment correlates with fewer economic opportunities.
Holding only 2 jobs in the year suggests some level of instability in employment, which can contribute moderately to the risk of rearrest.
Recent marijuana use over the past four years introduces a moderate risk factor, particularly in the context of criminal behavior patterns.
Not living alone can indicate some level of social support, thereby reducing recidivism risk.
Never having been married can be associated with less social stability, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
Growing up in a small household (size 2) with only the biological dad may imply limited familial support, contributing a moderate risk factor.
Growing up in a rural area is generally associated with lower rates of recidivism relative to urban environments.
Believing that God influences personal outcomes can be a protective factor that is associated with lower recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 4 inches and weighs 130 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological dad in a household of size 2, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
